instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panics
threads.message:
Bought this thing on ebay a while ago. Came without HDD, HDD cable, ODD, ODD cable. Trackpad cable ripped, many screws missing :confused:

Screen has signs of liquid damage, most likely dead. All 3 Backlight connector pads corroded, backlight fuse blown. Removed screen connector from board and waiting for new one to arrive.

The board:
- <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> corroded, replaced.
- <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> getting hot when charger plugged in, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> + surrounding SMD replaced.
- power rails from <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> missing, <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> replaced, rails present.
- minor corrosion at <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>. <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7126</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7131</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7133</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7196</CAPACITOR> replaced.

Now I got high RPM fan spin and chime. Really happy I managed to get fan spin.
I don't have a known good screen, so I'm working with mini DP out and external monitor.
Got question mark folder. Wanted to know why fan spins at high RPM, so I tried ASD EFI 3S132 on USB port, getting stuck at graphics while loading. With ASD OS I get Apple logo, circle animation, then kernel panic. I don't know how to continue at this point so I'm hoping for your help.

This is my first board I'm working on so I really hope I get it fixed. [SIZE=8px]Please don't tell me it's the GPU :([/SIZE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panics
threads.message:
Trackpad board, or trackpad flex can cause fan spining at max.
Check all traces from <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> to J5800.
Be sure J5800 gets all necesarry voltage.
